name: Timeline / Process Flow
description: Horizontal or vertical sequence of 3-7 numbered steps or milestones connected by lines or arrows, used to illustrate chronological events, implementation phases, or sequential processes. Each node has a label and optional description.

grid.columns: 1-16 (full-width for horizontal layout) or 3-14 (centered for vertical layout)

components: Timeline heading: $heading-04 above the timeline, describing the process name
Step nodes: numbered circles (40px diameter) in $blue-60 with white number text
Connector lines: 2px solid $ui-03 between nodes (horizontal or vertical)
Step label: $heading-03 or $body-short-01 bold in $text-01, adjacent to node
Step description: $body-short-01 in $text-02, 1-2 sentences max per step
Optional date/phase label: $label-01 in $text-03 below the node
Optional completion indicator: filled $green-60 node for completed steps, $ui-03 for future
rules: Minimum 3, maximum 7 steps — fewer than 3 doesn't justify a timeline; more than 7 exceeds page width/readability
Horizontal layout preferred for 3-5 steps on A4 landscape or full-width blocks; vertical for 5-7 steps or portrait
Each step node is numbered sequentially — numbers inside $blue-60 circles with $inverse-01 text
Connector lines use 2px $ui-03 — subtle enough to guide the eye without competing with node labels
Step labels use $heading-03 bold — the primary scannable content of the timeline
Step descriptions are optional but limited to 2 sentences max in $body-short-01 — detail belongs in body text
Equal spacing between all nodes — irregular spacing implies uneven importance or duration
Timeline block must not break across pages — use page-break-inside: avoid

printBehavior.pagePosition: flexible — timeline must stay on a single page
printBehavior.bleedHandling: no bleed — timeline stays within column bounds

accessibilityNotes: Use <ol> markup for sequential steps — screen readers need list semantics to convey order
Each step node number must be in the DOM (not just CSS-generated) for screen reader access
Connector lines between nodes must have aria-hidden='true' — decorative visual guides
Completion indicators ($green-60 vs $ui-03) must have text alternatives (e.g., 'Completed' / 'Upcoming')
antiPatterns: Never exceed 7 steps — a process with more steps should be grouped into phases with sub-steps in body text
Never use irregular spacing between nodes — it implies duration or importance differences that may not exist
Never omit step numbers — unlabeled nodes force readers to count, breaking the scannable sequence
Never add paragraphs of text to individual steps — each step gets 2 sentences max; use surrounding body text for detail
Never use decorative arrows or complex connector shapes — simple straight lines in $ui-03 are the Carbon standard
